perturbation.original_text: STW shall calculate the amount owed to COFS every one hundred-eighty (180) days ("Accrual Period"), and shall provide required payments to COFS within thirty (30) days after the end of the previous Accrual Period.
perturbation.changed_text: STW shall calculate the amount owed to COFS every one hundred-eighty (180) days ("Accrual Period"), and shall provide required payments to COFS within forty-five (45) days after the end of the previous Accrual Period.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a direct conflict with the original payment deadline of 30 days in Section 14(b). The modified text now states that payments are due within 45 days, introducing uncertainty about which deadline is enforceable.

perturbation.original_text: COFS shall manage well maintenance and production operations for all CRA water produced within Pecos County under the direction of STW. STW shall pay COFS for its reasonable costs incurred to manage such well maintenance and production operations.
perturbation.changed_text: COFS shall manage well maintenance and production operations for all CRA water produced within Pecos County under the direction of STW. COFS is responsible for all costs incurred to manage such well maintenance and production operations.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text states that COFS is responsible for all the costs which directly contradicts the previous statement stating that STW is responsible for all the costs. This creates a direct conflict and ambiguity about who is responsible for those costs.

perturbation.original_text: The Party claiming the Force Majeure shall use due diligence to resume performance at the earliest practicable time, and such suspension shall not extend for a period longer than twenty-four (24) months from the date notice of the Force Majeure is provided without payment as set forth under Section 15(a) of this AGREEMENT by STW, or the option to terminate this AGREEMENT by STW if COFS is the party asserting the Force Majeure.
perturbation.changed_text: The Party claiming the Force Majeure shall use due diligence to resume performance at the earliest practicable time, and such suspension shall not extend for a period longer than twelve (12) months from the date notice of the Force Majeure is provided without payment as set forth under Section 15(a) of this AGREEMENT by STW, or the option to terminate this AGREEMENT by STW if COFS is the party asserting the Force Majeure.
perturbation.explanation: This change alters the maximum duration of a Force Majeure suspension from 24 months to 12 months. This creates a direct conflict within the contract as the parties are left unsure of the actual allowable suspension period.
